org.opentrafficsim.core.value

Interface MathFunctions

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DoubleMathFunctions, FloatMathFunctions
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MutableDoubleMatrix, MutableDoubleMatrix.Abs, MutableDoubleMatrix.Abs.Dense, MutableDoubleMatrix.Abs.Sparse, MutableDoubleMatrix.Rel, MutableDoubleMatrix.Rel.Dense, MutableDoubleMatrix.Rel.Sparse, MutableDoubleScalar, MutableDoubleScalar.Abs, MutableDoubleScalar.Rel, MutableDoubleVector, MutableDoubleVector.Abs, MutableDoubleVector.Abs.Dense, MutableDoubleVector.Abs.Sparse, MutableDoubleVector.Rel, MutableDoubleVector.Rel.Dense, MutableDoubleVector.Rel.Sparse, MutableFloatMatrix, MutableFloatMatrix.Abs, MutableFloatMatrix.Abs.Dense, MutableFloatMatrix.Abs.Sparse, MutableFloatMatrix.Rel, MutableFloatMatrix.Rel.Dense, MutableFloatMatrix.Rel.Sparse, MutableFloatScalar, MutableFloatScalar.Abs, MutableFloatScalar.Rel, MutableFloatVector, MutableFloatVector.Abs, MutableFloatVector.Abs.Dense, MutableFloatVector.Abs.Sparse, MutableFloatVector.Rel, MutableFloatVector.Rel.Dense, MutableFloatVector.Rel.Sparse

    public interface MathFunctions
extends Serializable
    Interface to force all functions of Math to be implemented.

    Copyright (c) 2014 Delft University of Technology, PO Box 5, 2600 AA, Delft, the Netherlands. All rights reserved.
    BSD-style license. See OpenTrafficSim License.

    Version:
    Jun 15, 2014
    Author:
    Alexander Verbraeck, Peter Knoppers

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abs()
      Set the value(s) to their absolute value.
      void acos()
      Set the value(s) to the arc cosine of the value(s); the angle is in the range 0.0 through pi.
      void asin()
      Set the value(s) to the arc sine of the value(s); the angle is in the range -pi/2 through pi/2.
      void atan()
      Set the value(s) to the arc tangent of the value(s); the angle is in the range -pi/2 through pi/2.
      void cbrt()
      Set the value(s) to the cube root.
      void ceil()
      Set the value(s) to the smallest (closest to negative infinity) value(s) that are greater than or equal to the argument and equal to a mathematical integer.
      void cos()
      Set the value(s) to the trigonometric cosine of the value(s).
      void cosh()
      Set the value(s) to the hyperbolic cosine of the value(s).
      void exp()
      Set the value(s) to Euler's number e raised to the power of the value(s).
      void expm1()
      Set the value(s) to e to the power of the value(s) minus 1 (e^x - 1).
      void floor()
      Set the value(s) to the largest (closest to positive infinity) value(s) that are less than or equal to the argument and equal to a mathematical integer.
      void inv()
      Set the value(s) to the complement (1.0/x) of the value(s).
      void log()
      Set the value(s) to the natural logarithm (base e) of the value(s).
      void log10()
      Set the value(s) to the base 10 logarithm of the value(s).
      void log1p()
      Set the value(s) to the natural logarithm of the sum of the argument and 1.
      void pow(double x)
      Set the value(s) to the value(s) raised to the power of the argument.
      void rint()
      Set the value(s) to the value(s) that are closest in value to the argument and equal to a mathematical integer.
      void round()
      Set the value(s) to the closest long to the argument, with ties rounding up.
      void signum()
      Set the value(s) to the signum function of the value(s); zero if the argument is zero, 1.0 if the argument is greater than zero, -1.0 if the argument is less than zero.
      void sin()
      Set the value(s) to the trigonometric sine of the value(s).
      void sinh()
      Set the value(s) to the hyperbolic sine of the value(s).
      void sqrt()
      Set the value(s) to the correctly rounded positive square root of the value(s).
      void tan()
      Set the value(s) to the trigonometric tangent of the value(s).
      void tanh()
      Set the value(s) to the hyperbolic tangent of the value(s).
      void toDegrees()
      Set the value(s) to approximately equivalent angle(s) measured in degrees.
      void toRadians()
      Set the value(s) to approximately equivalent angle(s) measured in radians.

        void log1p()
        Set the value(s) to the natural logarithm of the sum of the argument and 1.

      • pow

        void pow(double x)
        Set the value(s) to the value(s) raised to the power of the argument.
        Parameters:
        x - the value to use as the power

        void rint()
        Set the value(s) to the value(s) that are closest in value to the argument and equal to a mathematical integer.

        void round()
        Set the value(s) to the closest long to the argument, with ties rounding up.

      • signum

        void signum()
        Set the value(s) to the signum function of the value(s); zero if the argument is zero, 1.0 if the argument is greater than zero, -1.0 if the argument is less than zero.

        Set the value(s) to the trigonometric sine of the value(s).

        void sinh()
        Set the value(s) to the hyperbolic sine of the value(s).

        Set the value(s) to the correctly rounded positive square root of the value(s).

        void tanh()

      • toDegrees

        void toDegrees()
        Set the value(s) to approximately equivalent angle(s) measured in degrees.

      • toRadians

        void toRadians()
        Set the value(s) to approximately equivalent angle(s) measured in radians.

      • inv

        void inv()
        Set the value(s) to the complement (1.0/x) of the value(s).
